page.title: 17BUILDINGS:DANE END HALL
page.content: {The Dane End Memorial Hall}was erected in 1922 at a cost of Â£1000. The money was raised by donations, one half being given by{Lord Gladstone. A Hall Committee was formed and hiring fees together with fund raising activities cover the upkeep of the building.The hall has seating for 120 people and has a well equipped kitchen. New toilets and overhead electrical heating was installed in 1965. {A Roll of Honour}for those who fought in the two World Wars hangs in the hall. The hall is used by many organisations such as Play Group, Friendship Club, Girl Guides, Scouts,Women's Institute, Local History Society and Dancing Classes. A General Practitioner from Watton at Stone holds a surgery in a back room once a week.
